intro: Coccinia buettneriana, commonly known as the African leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellow-orange flowers. Its fruits are round and typically turn red when mature, often containing several seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
